Metadata.title: Startup Base
Metadata.description: StartupBase.uz is a unique platform that unites promising startups, their founders, partners, and investors in Uzbekistan's thriving innovation ecosystem. Our mission is to create a collaborative space where entrepreneurs can connect, grow, and access opportunities to bring their ideas to life. Explore our ecosystem, register your startup, and discover events, funding opportunities, and valuable resources to accelerate your success.

Patent.instruction:
Instructions for submitting an application: 
 All required documents must be attached to the application. The applicant has the right to withdraw the application within 3 calendar days from the date of submission. In case of refusal, the applicant has the right to correct the deficiencies indicated by the Expert Commission and re-submit the application
Patent.patentDescription:
Mechanism for Reimbursement of Expenses for Patent Filing and Intellectual Property (IP) Registration, Including Trademarks
The mechanism for reimbursing expenses related to patent filing, intellectual property (IP) registration, and trademarks is designed to support startups registered in Uzbekistan.

Who Can Apply:
- Legal entities registered in Uzbekistan.
- Startups that have applied to the digital startups program and successfully passed the selection process on the platform startupbase.uz.

Expenses Eligible for Reimbursement:
- Government fees for registering rights to IP objects.
- Services of patent attorneys.

Review Procedure:
- Applications are reviewed by the Expert Commission within 15 business days.
- Upon approval, the applicant receives a notification via the platform or email.
- Funds are transferred to the applicant's bank account within 10 banking days after signing the reimbursement agreement.

Grounds for Rejection:
- Incomplete or inaccurate data.
- Non-compliance with the regulation requirements.
- Absence of mandatory information.

If errors are found, the application is returned for revision with a notification sent via email. Corrections are made in the applicant's account on startupbase.uz, after which the application is resubmitted.

Coverage.entrepreneurship: Entrepreneurship, Business, or Corporate Governance Course
Coverage.nameAccelerationProgramOrCourse: Name of the acceleration program or course
Coverage.organizationProvidingProgramOrCourse: Organization providing the program or course
Coverage.durationProgramOrCourse: Duration of the program or course (in months)
Coverage.describeObjectives: Describe the objectives set before participation and the results achieved
Coverage.totalNumberOfParticipants: Total number of participants from the startup
Coverage.actualDaysAccommodation: Actual days of accommodation (daily allowance as per norms)
Coverage.certificateOfParticipation: Certificate of participation or completion of the acceleration program/course
Coverage.financialReportConfirming: Financial report confirming actual expenses (receipts, invoices, contracts).
Coverage.descriptionProgramOrCourse: Description of the program or course (contents, modules, schedule)
Coverage.resumesOfInstructors: Resumes of instructors or program organizers (for courses)
Coverage.confirmationProgram: Confirmation of the program's ranking (if applicable)
Coverage.descriptionOfExplanatoryNote: Describe why your startup needs to participate in this acceleration program or course. Specify how this contributes to the development of your business and the digital technology ecosystem in Uzbekistan.
Coverage.confirmCorrectives: I confirm that all provided data and documents are accurate and meet the requirements of the regulations
Coverage.IAmFamiliar: I am familiar with the terms of reimbursement
Coverage.readyToBe: I am ready to participate in an interview with the Expert Commission (if required)
Coverage.notes: Notes: The maximum reimbursement is up to 50% of the total expenses, but not exceeding USD 20,000. To qualify for reimbursement the acceleration program or course must meet approved criteria. Additional expenses not included in the program or course cost are not subject to reimbursement.
Coverage.coverageDescription:
The compensation mechanism is designed to support startups participating in leading international acceleration programs and educational courses on entrepreneurship, business and corporate management.

Who can apply:
Legal entities registered in Uzbekistan.
Startups that have applied to the digital startup program and successfully passed the selection process on the startupbase.uz platform.

What expenses are compensated:
Up to 50% of the costs associated with participation in international acceleration programs or courses (but not more than USD 20,000).
Airfare (economy class) and accommodation expenses within the established limits.

What you need to apply:
Fill out an application on the startupbase.uz platform.

Review procedure:
The application is reviewed by the Expert Commission within 15 business days.
Documents are checked for completeness and compliance with requirements.
If approved, funds are transferred to the applicant's bank account within 10 banking days after signing the agreement.

Reasons for refusal:
Incomplete or inaccurate data.
Failure to comply with the requirements of the regulation.
Lack of supporting documents.

If errors are found, the application is sent for revision with notification via email. Corrections are made in the personal account on startupbase.uz, after which the application is re-submitted.

OnePOne.productDetails: Brief description of the product or service
OnePOne.DProductDetails: Describe your product/service, its main purpose, and target audience
OnePOne.DTargetAudience: Describe your main customer and target market
OnePOne.DInvestmentHistory: Describe how much funding you previously raised, from whom, and how it was used
OnePOne.DFutureForecasts: Indicate expected revenue, profit, and other key indicators
OnePOne.vcFundName: Name of the foreign venture fund
OnePOne.DFundDescription: Origin of the fund, key activities, authorized capital
OnePOne.totalRaised: Total amount of investments raised from the venture fund
OnePOne.requestedAmount: Requested amount from the venture fund at the Directorate (in USD)
OnePOne.DInvestmentUse: Describe what you plan to use the funds raised for
OnePOne.notes: Note: The maximum investment amount from the venture fund under the Directorate is no more than USD 100,000. Investments are provided on the terms of joining the shareholders or participants with the allocation of shares/stakes in the authorized capital of the startup. All documents must be valid and confirm the declared data.
OnePOne.linkToInformation: Link to information from a publicly available, reliable source
OnePOne.documentConfirmingInvestment: Document confirming the fact of investment
OnePOne.onePOneDescription:
The investment fund mechanism is designed to support startups that have attracted investments from foreign venture funds managing assets exceeding USD 50 million. To apply, you need to:

Who Can Apply:

-Legal entities registered in Uzbekistan.
-Startups that have applied to the digital startups program and successfully passed the selection process on the platform startupbase.uz.
-Startups that have attracted investments from foreign venture funds managing assets exceeding USD 50 million.

What is Provided:
Investment funds proportional to the attracted investments, but not exceeding USD 100,000.

Required Documents for Application:
Complete the application on the startupbase.uz platform.

Review Process:
Applications are reviewed by the Venture Fund within 15 business days.
Documents are checked for completeness and compliance with requirements.
The Investment Committee makes the final decision.
If approved, the applicant signs an investment agreement, and funds are transferred to the bank account within 5 business days.

Reasons for Rejection:
Incomplete or inaccurate information.
Non-compliance with the regulation's requirements.
Misuse of the attracted funds.

If errors are found, the application is returned for revision with a notification sent via email. Corrections are made in the applicant's account on startupbase.uz, after which the application is resubmitted.

CreditVenture.creditHistorySource: Credit history can be obtained through the my.gov website
CreditVenture.projectDescription: Brief description of the startup project
CreditVenture.describeProduct: Describe the product or service offered by your startup
CreditVenture.loanAmount: Requested loan amount (up to 300 million sum)
CreditVenture.describeUsage: Describe how the funds will be used
CreditVenture.registrationCertificate: Certificate of state registration of a legal entity
CreditVenture.foundersDecision: Founders' decision to obtain loan funds
CreditVenture.repaymentSchedule: Repayment schedule (approved jointly with the venture fund)
CreditVenture.submissionInstructions: Submission instructions: All specified documents must be attached to the application. The applicant may withdraw the application within 3 calendar days of submission. The expert group reviews the application within 30 working days. In case of refusal, a notification with reasons is provided.
CreditVenture.notes: Notes: The maximum loan amount is 300 million sums. The loan term ranges from 6 months to 3 years. All funds must be used strictly for the purposes specified in the application. In case of breach of the agreement, the borrower bears responsibility as provided by the regulations and the legislation of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
CreditVenture.creditVentureDescription:
Who can apply:
Legal entities registered in Uzbekistan.
Startups registered and selected on the startupbase.uz platform.
Startups with a transparent credit history and a clear business plan.

What funds are provided:
Loan funds in the amount of up to 300 million soums with an interest rate (the main rate of the Central Bank + 4%).
The loan term varies from 6 months to 3 years.

What is needed to apply:
Fill out an application on the startupbase.uz platform.
Attach all the necessary documents:
Accounting statements: company balance sheet, profit and loss statement, cash flow statement.
Tax returns.
Detailed business plan (goals, market analysis, profitability forecast, risks).
Certificate of state registration of a legal entity.
Constituent documents.
Decision of the founders of the startup on the intention to receive borrowed funds.

Goals of using borrowed funds:
Product development.
Entry into the market.
Scaling the business.
Other goals (specified in the application).
Application review procedure:
Submission stage:
The application is submitted through the personal account on startupbase.uz.

Verification stage:
The documents are checked for completeness and compliance with the requirements within 30 business days by the expert group of the Venture Fund.

Decision-making stage:
The Investment Committee reviews the application and makes a decision.

Contract signing stage:
If approved, the contract is signed, after which the funds are transferred to the applicant's bank account within 5 banking days.

Grounds for refusal:
Incomplete or inaccurate data.
Non-compliance with the requirements of the regulation.
Bad credit history or no credit history.
Violation of the rules for the targeted use of borrowed funds.

Correction of errors:
In case of errors in the application, the applicant receives a notification via e-mail.
Corrections are made through the personal account on the platform, after which the application is re-submitted.

CoverageMentor.programGoalDescription: Describe the program goal, its objectives, and the outcomes you plan to achieve.
CoverageMentor.startupCount: Number of startups that participated in the program
CoverageMentor.successDefinition: For incubation: startups that achieved first sales. For acceleration: startups that scaled.
CoverageMentor.mentorTrainerCount: Total number of mentors and trainers
CoverageMentor.mentorContracts: Scanned versions of contracts with mentors and trainers
CoverageMentor.programDescription: Description of the incubation and/or acceleration program (with signature and seal)
CoverageMentor.explanatoryNoteDescription: Describe why your project needs compensation for mentor and trainer costs. Explain how this contributes to the development of startups and the digital technology ecosystem in Uzbekistan.
CoverageMentor.submissionInstructions: Application Instructions: All specified documents must be attached to the application. The applicant has the right to submit a preliminary application for an estimate of the estimated amount of compensation. The applicant may withdraw the application within 3 calendar days from the date of submission. The expert committee will review the application within 15 working days. In case of refusal, a notice is provided stating the reasons.
CoverageMentor.notes: Note: Compensation is provided only after the completion of the incubation or acceleration program. The maximum compensation amount is 50% of the total costs, but does not exceed $50,000 per year. All criteria, including the number of startups, the professional experience of mentors and the format of the program, will be taken into account when calculating the compensation amount.
CoverageMentor.coverageMentorDescription:
Incubation and acceleration cost compensation program
Who can apply:
Legal entities registered in Uzbekistan.
Organizations that implement incubation or acceleration programs for startups.
Programs that have successfully completed the selection stages and confirm the development of the startup ecosystem in Uzbekistan.
What funds are provided:
Compensation for the costs of hiring mentors, trainers and organizing programs in the amount of up to 50% of total expenses, but not more than 50,000 USD per year.

What you need to apply for:
Fill out an application on the platform startupbase.uz .
Attach the necessary documents:
The final report on the program.
Scanned versions of contracts with mentors and trainers.
Financial documents confirming the actual expenses.
A detailed description of the incubation or acceleration program.
Application review procedure:
Submission stage:
The application is submitted through your personal account at startupbase.uz .
Verification stage:
The documents are checked for completeness and compliance with the requirements within 15 working days.
Decision-making stage:
The Expert Commission reviews the application and decides on the amount of compensation.
Compensation payment stage:
If approved, the funds will be transferred to the applicant's bank account within 5 business days.

AIEcosystemExplorer.exploreStartupEcosystemUsing: Explore startup ecosystem using AI Tool
AIEcosystemExplorer.aiDescription1: An intelligent AI chatbot designed to simplify interaction with Uzbekistan's startup ecosystem. This new real-time assistant answers user questions, helps find startups, investors, acceleration programs, and current events.
AIEcosystemExplorer.aiDescription2: Thanks to integration with the platform's database, the chatbot provides quick access to the necessary information and makes navigating StartupBase.uz even more convenient for startups, partners, and investors.

shortDescription.incubator: Compensation of up to 50% of costs (up to $20,000) for startups from Uzbekistan participating in international accelerator programs and business and management educational courses
shortDescription.onePlusOne: Co-financing of startups from Uzbekistan up to $100,000 when attracting investments from foreign venture funds with assets of $50 million or more.
shortDescription.award: Compensation for state fees and patent attorney services for startups from Uzbekistan during the registration of intellectual property and trademarks
shortDescription.pta: President Tech Award is a competition for the best software products across 5 main and 1 special direction. The aim of the competition is to attract the attention of youth to the IT technologies sphere and inspire them to create innovative solutions and developments capable of competing on the global market
shortDescription.venture: Startups from Uzbekistan can obtain loans of up to 300 million soums at the Central Bank rate plus 4% without collateral
shortDescription.stars: Compensation of up to 50% (up to $50,000 per year) for organizations in Uzbekistan conducting incubation and acceleration programs for startups

Roles.startupDescription: A startup is a young technology company in the early stages of development, striving to scale its solution and attract investment through acceleration and incubation on the StartupBase platform.
Roles.partnerDescription: A partner is a commercial organization or institution that forms strategic alliances with other ecosystem participants for mutual growth and resource sharing.
Roles.investorDescription: An investor is an individual or legal entity that invests capital in projects on StartupBase with the expectation of financial return or strategic partnership.
Roles.VCDescription: A Venture Capital Fund (VC) is a private equity fund specializing in investing in startups and companies with high growth potential in exchange for equity.
Roles.acceleratorDescription: An accelerator is a competitive, selective program offering intensive support to startups, including funding, mentorship, and preparation for future investment rounds, lasting several months.
Roles.mentorDescription: A mentor is an experienced professional who supports less experienced startup founders by guiding their professional and personal growth through mentoring and consultations
Roles.startupPrivileges1: Acceleration and incubation coverage: up to 50% of costs (maximum $20,000) for participation in international accelerator programs and business education courses.
Roles.startupPrivileges2: 1+1 Program: co-financing of up to $100,000 upon attracting investments from foreign venture capital funds with assets of over $50 million.
Roles.startupPrivileges3: Patent Program: reimbursement of government fees and patent attorney services for the registration of intellectual property and trademarks.
Roles.startupPrivileges5: President Tech Award: participation in the national-level competition for the best IT solutions.
Roles.startupPrivileges6: IT-Visa: preferential regime for international experts (coming soon).
Roles.partnerPrivileges1: Cost reduction and joint projects: participation in collaborative initiatives reduces operational costs through cooperation.
Roles.partnerPrivileges2: Increased competitive advantages: access to innovations and platform startups creates a co-opetitive effect.
Roles.partnerPrivileges3: Co-branding opportunities: joint branding at StartupBase and IT Park events.
Roles.partnerPrivileges4: Networking and knowledge exchange: priority access to expert circles and potential clients.
Roles.investorPrivileges1: Access to selected startups: first to receive pitch decks of promising projects on the platform.
Roles.investorPrivileges2: Due diligence tools: templates and support from IT Park for risk assessment.
Roles.investorPrivileges3: Co-investment and syndication: possibility to team up with other investors to increase investment amounts.
Roles.VCPrivileges1: State co-financing: “1+1” program for funds attracting foreign investment, up to $100,000.
Roles.VCPrivileges2: Partnership with IT Park Ventures: access to government grants and the roadmap for 2024–2026.
Roles.VCPrivileges3: Co-investments with international funds: streamlined mechanisms for closing deals with global LPs.
Roles.acceleratorPrivileges1: Funding and infrastructure: seed grants and workspace for the duration of the program.
Roles.acceleratorPrivileges2: Mentor network: regular sessions with industry experts and investors.
Roles.acceleratorPrivileges3: Expert expense reimbursement: up to 50% of costs (maximum $50,000 per year) for organizers and partners.
Roles.mentorPrivileges1: Expanded expertise: opportunity to influence the development of early-stage innovative projects.
Roles.mentorPrivileges2: Expense coverage: reimbursement of startup expenses for hiring external experts and consultants.
Roles.mentorPrivileges3: Recognition and networking: public recognition in mentor profiles on StartupBase and IT Park, with access to closed events.

FAQ.startup_what_is_answer: A startup is a young company focused on a fast-growing market, offering an innovative product or service, often with a scalable business model.
FAQ.startup_vs_small_business: How is a startup different from a small business?
FAQ.startup_vs_small_business_answer: A startup aims for rapid growth and scalability, while a small business focuses on steady income and local stability.
FAQ.startup_tech_related: Does a startup have to be tech-related?
FAQ.startup_tech_related_answer: A startup should include digital solutions.
FAQ.startup_signs: What are the signs that a project is a startup?
FAQ.startup_signs_answer: Innovation, high uncertainty, scalability potential, and the need for external funding.
FAQ.startup_founders: Who are the Founder and Co-Founder of a startup?
FAQ.startup_founders_answer: The Founder is the originator of the idea and usually plays a key role in the development of the product and team. A Co-Founder is someone who joins from the beginning and helps establish the company (usually from scratch).
FAQ.how_to_come_up_with_idea: How to come up with a startup idea?
FAQ.how_to_come_up_with_idea_answer: Observe people's problems, study the market and trends, and rely on personal experience and user pain points.
FAQ.how_to_check_relevance: How to check if my idea is relevant?
FAQ.how_to_check_relevance_answer: Get feedback from potential customers, conduct interviews, analyze competitors, and evaluate the market.
FAQ.what_is_incubation_answer: It's a support program for early-stage startups offering mentorship, training, and sometimes workspace.
FAQ.where_find_incubators_answer: In universities, tech companies, tech parks, accelerators, and government entrepreneurship programs.
FAQ.how_to_build_team: How to build a team at the early stage?
FAQ.how_to_build_team_answer: Start with like-minded people with complementary skills: one handles the product, another the business, and another the tech side.
FAQ.how_to_protect_idea: How to protect an idea from being copied?
FAQ.how_to_protect_idea_answer: You can use an NDA, but the main defense is fast execution and focusing on a unique implementation.
FAQ.what_is_mvp_answer: Minimum Viable Product — a basic version of the product that demonstrates its core value to users.
FAQ.how_to_build_mvp_answer: Identify the product’s key function and implement it with minimal resources to test with users.
FAQ.how_to_prepare_pitch: How to prepare a project presentation?
FAQ.how_to_prepare_pitch_answer: Create a pitch deck: problem, solution, market, business model, competitors, team, financial plan, roadmap.
FAQ.register_at_idea_stage: Do I need to register a company at the idea stage?
FAQ.register_at_idea_stage_answer: Not necessarily. Do it when you have your first client or need legal relationships.
FAQ.what_is_pre_seed_answer: This is the phase where you have an idea, team, and possibly a prototype, but haven't raised significant investments yet. The goal is to validate the problem and test early hypotheses.
FAQ.pre_seed_goals: What are the goals at Pre-Seed?
FAQ.pre_seed_goals_answer: Validate the product need, build an MVP, conduct early user tests, gather feedback.
FAQ.where_to_find_pre_seed_funding: Where to find funding at Pre-Seed?
FAQ.where_to_find_pre_seed_funding_answer: Founders often use personal funds, help from friends and family, and join hackathons, incubators, or accelerators.
FAQ.what_is_acceleration_answer: An acceleration program helps fast-track startups by providing mentorship, training, networking, and usually seed funding ($20k–$150k) in exchange for 5–15% equity.
FAQ.incubator_vs_accelerator: What’s the difference between an incubator and an accelerator?
FAQ.incubator_vs_accelerator_answer: Incubators help at the idea and MVP stage; accelerators focus on early traction and help scale the startup.
FAQ.who_is_business_angel_answer: A private investor who invests their own money into early-stage startups, offering not just funding but also mentorship, expertise, and connections.
FAQ.what_is_vc_fund: What is a venture capital fund?
FAQ.what_is_vc_fund_answer: An investment firm that pools capital from limited partners (LPs) and invests it in high-growth startups. Unlike angels, VCs act institutionally and systematically.
FAQ.important_metrics_pre_seed: What metrics are important at Pre-Seed?
FAQ.important_metrics_pre_seed_answer: MVP user count, conversion rates, early feedback, interest registration, initial revenue (if any), engagement level.
FAQ.what_to_include_pitch: What to include in a Pre-Seed pitch?
FAQ.what_to_include_pitch_answer: Problem, solution, market validation, MVP, team, market size, growth strategy, funding ask and use.
FAQ.how_to_structure_investments_answer: Common tools include SAFE (Simple Agreement for Future Equity) or convertible notes, allowing early investment in exchange for future equity.
FAQ.what_is_seed_answer: At this stage, the startup has a working MVP and early users and aims to scale the product.
FAQ.seed_goals: What are the goals at Seed?
FAQ.seed_goals_answer: Achieve product-market fit, grow the team, scale marketing, optimize the sales funnel.
FAQ.seed_investors: Who invests at the Seed stage?
FAQ.seed_investors_answer: Business angels, seed funds, and small venture capital firms.
FAQ.showing_traction_answer: Growth metrics: user count, revenue, repeat usage, lower customer acquisition cost.
FAQ.seed_funding_amount: How much is usually raised at Seed?
FAQ.seed_funding_amount_answer: From $100,000 to $2 million, depending on region, market, and startup ambition.
FAQ.seed_common_mistakes_answer: Premature scaling, lack of focus, weak analytics, overestimating the idea’s value.
FAQ.what_investors_care: What do investors care about at Seed?
FAQ.what_investors_care_answer: Team, early traction, market size, unique value proposition, clear growth strategy.
FAQ.what_is_pre_series_a_answer: It’s the bridge between Seed and Series A, where the startup has revenue but isn’t ready for a large funding round.
FAQ.when_pre_series_a: When is it time for Pre-Series A?
FAQ.when_pre_series_a_answer: When your product is stable, you’re generating revenue, and you need investment to prepare for scaling.
FAQ.pre_series_a_metrics: What key metrics should be achieved?
FAQ.pre_series_a_metrics_answer: Revenue of $10–50k per month, user base growth, validated business model.
FAQ.pre_series_a_goals_answer: Improve key metrics, automate operations, prepare for investor due diligence.
FAQ.pre_series_a_challenges_answer: It’s hard to find investors at this stage if the startup isn’t "quite ready yet."
FAQ.what_is_series_a_answer: An investment round when the startup has proven viability and is ready to scale.
FAQ.series_a_amount_answer: From $2 million to $15 million depending on the industry and region.
FAQ.series_a_investors_answer: Large venture capital firms, sometimes corporate venture capital (CVC).
FAQ.series_a_documents_answer: Financial model, reports, cap table, due diligence documents, pitch deck.
FAQ.series_a_criteria_answer: Growth, strong metrics, high LTV (Lifetime Value), low CAC (Customer Acquisition Cost), clear go-to-market strategy.
FAQ.series_a_risks: Risks that may scare off investors?
FAQ.series_a_risks_answer: Lack of transparency, unstable team, weak unit economics.
FAQ.what_is_series_b_answer: A round focused on accelerated scaling — entering international markets, team expansion, automation.
FAQ.series_b_goals_answer: Capture market share, grow revenue, dominate a niche.
FAQ.series_b_amount_answer: Usually from $10 million to $50 million and more.
FAQ.series_b_kpis_answer: KPI (Key Performance Indicators) are key metrics used to measure the startup’s progress. At later stages, the most important include:
FAQ.series_b_needed_kpis_answer: Stable MRR/ARR growth, high margins, stable customer base.
FAQ.series_b_structure_answer: More management layers, expanded HR and marketing departments, creation of sales and analytics teams.
FAQ.series_b_investors_answer: Late-stage venture funds, private equity firms, sometimes strategic partners.
FAQ.series_c_prep: How to prepare for Series C and beyond?
FAQ.series_c_prep_answer: Develop a large-scale growth strategy, consider IPO/exit, attract strong advisors.
FAQ.exit_strategy_answer: A plan for investor return: IPO, acquisition (M&A), or share buyback.
FAQ.bootstrap_success: Can a startup succeed without external funding?
FAQ.bootstrap_success_answer: Yes, this is called bootstrapping — requires early revenue and strict cost control.
FAQ.kpi_definition: What is a KPI (Key Performance Indicator)?
FAQ.kpi_definition_answer: A metric used to measure how well an individual, team, or company achieves its set goals.

Home.title: Apply
Home.description: Eurasian project for foreign startups with a total prize fund
Home.resultText1: Digital Startup Awards — your gateway to the global stage!
Home.resultText2: If you're building a startup — from idea to scaling — and ready to level up, you're in the right place.
Home.resultText3: This is not just a competition, but a full support program for founders ready to grow, learn, and attract investment. You will gain access to international expertise, investment opportunities, and a global partner network. We’ll help you strengthen your business model, attract investment, and expand into new markets. Three tracks. Strong expertise. Honest feedback.
Home.geoText1: Digital Startup Awards brings together founders from 8 countries: Central Asia, the Caucasus, and Mongolia. You’ll become part of a strong regional community — among those who, like you, build, take risks, and dream big. It’s a great chance to meet like-minded people and build lasting connections.
Home.yourIdeaInternational: Your idea — on the international stage
Home.projectPitchRegional: Tell the world about your project and stand out on a regional platform that unites the brightest minds of the region.
Home.investmentAndResources: Investment and resources to take your idea to the next level.
Home.mentorshipSupport: Support from practitioners who’ve already gone from idea to global success.
Home.expandToNewMarkets: Enter new markets and gain the tools and knowledge for your next stage of development.
Home.globalConnections: Investors, corporations, accelerators, and entrepreneurs from different countries — this is where strong connections and partnerships are born
Home.mentorsAndLeadersSupport: Mentors, successful startup founders, and industry leaders will help you avoid mistakes and accelerate your growth.
Home.mediaAndCommunityExposure: You’ll get noticed: in the media, on social platforms, and in the professional community.
Home.bestStartupProjectDesc: Compete for the title of the best startup across 8 countries and attract direct investment.
Home.incubationDesc: Have an idea but don’t know how to move it forward? This program is for you!
Home.accelerationDesc: Ready to scale and expand into new markets? Join the acceleration track!
Home.partnersDescription: Partners of Digital Startup Awards are international organizations and investors helping startups grow from idea to a full MVP project
Home.whoCanApplyAnswer: Startups at the idea stage, with an MVP, or early sales. Founders/startups must be from one of the eligible countries. Startups from any industry are welcome.
Home.ageRestrictionsAnswer: There are no age limits. The main requirement is your motivation and readiness to actively participate in the program
Home.teamRestrictionsQuestion: Are there any team size restrictions?
Home.teamRestrictionsAnswer: No restrictions on team size, but only founders can take part in the incubation and acceleration programs.
Home.formatQuestion: Is the program online or offline?
Home.formatAnswer: Incubation — fully online. Acceleration — offline, founders must stay in Tashkent for the whole program. Demo Days — offline.
Home.englishRequiredAnswer: Yes, the working language of the program is English. All participants must be able to communicate fluently with mentors and trackers
Home.participationFeeAnswer: No, the program is free for selected startups
Home.fundingProvidedAnswer: Yes, startups can receive funding upon achieving the KPIs set at the beginning of the program
Home.previousParticipationQuestion: Can I apply if I’ve already been in an incubator or accelerator?
Home.previousParticipationAnswer: Yes, if your project meets the criteria for the stage you’re applying to.

bestStartupProject.text2: Participants apply on behalf of their country and go through two selection stages:
bestStartupProject.text4: National semifinals (in the country of application).
bestStartupProject.text5: Women-founded startups will take part in a dedicated online semi-final.
bestStartupProject.text6: 5 top-performing teams will qualify for the final and compete equally with all other finalists.
bestStartupProject.text7: If a women-led startup qualifies as one of the two national finalists through the main semi-final, it is permitted.
bestStartupProject.text9: Startups at Seed / Series A stage
bestStartupProject.text12: Startup registered in one of the 9 countries
bestStartupProject.localSemifinalOption1: Pitches in the country of application, 2 startups are selected
bestStartupProject.finalTashkentOption2: Criteria will be announced before Demo Day
bestStartupProject.finalPresentationLanguage: Final pitch in front of an international jury is conducted in English.
bestStartupProject.investmentRequirements2: To receive investment, winners must register a legal entity in Uzbekistan and sign an agreement with IT Park Uzbekistan.

AccelerationProgram.text1: The DSA Acceleration Program is an offline program for startups at the Product-Market Fit stage and active growth. It’s designed to support scaling in the Uzbekistan market and expansion to international markets
AccelerationProgram.text2: Participants get help with launching sales, preparing for investment, and developing a market entry strategy
AccelerationProgram.text4: Startups at Product-Market Fit stage with at least 3 months of sales (traction)
AccelerationProgram.text5: At least one founder must be present during the whole program (accommodation is covered by IT Park Uzbekistan)
AccelerationProgram.text6: Willingness to work intensively, scale, and enter new markets throughout the program
AccelerationProgram.onlineProgramTitle: Online program with a practical focus
AccelerationProgram.onlineProgramDesc: A 10-week online program with international expert workshops, regular mentoring sessions, and hands-on work on your product and business-model
AccelerationProgram.mentorshipDesc: You’ll receive professional feedback on your hypotheses, product, and strategy at each stage of the program
AccelerationProgram.caseStudiesTitle: Case studies, simulations, and practical projects
AccelerationProgram.caseStudiesDesc: The program is built around practice — you’ll not only learn, but also build your startup step-by-step
AccelerationProgram.marketSupportTitle: Go-to-market support and final Demo Day
AccelerationProgram.marketSupportDesc: We’ll help you prepare your pitch, test your audience, and present at the final Demo Day in Tashkent to international investors and VC funds
AccelerationProgram.fundingDesc: The top 15 teams will each receive $10,000 in funding upon successful completion of  KPIs. The funding will be provided towards the end of the program
AccelerationProgram.prSupportTitle: PR support from IT Park Uzbekistan
AccelerationProgram.prSupportDesc: You’ll receive media coverage, announcements, and support throughout all key stages of the program
AccelerationProgram.trackingDesc: You’ll work with one of the top trackers in Central Asia. Expect personal strategy sessions, growth support, and KPI monitoring
AccelerationProgram.investmentModelDesc:
You can receive up to $50,000, distributed in stages:
• first tranche — in Week 4 of the program
• subsequent tranches — every 4 weeks upon meeting KPIs
AccelerationProgram.livingWorkspaceTitle: Free accommodation and workspace covered by the program
AccelerationProgram.livingWorkspaceDesc: Free housing and coworking space in Tashkent are provided for one or two founders
AccelerationProgram.marketAccessTitle: Entry into the Uzbekistan market (37+ million population)
AccelerationProgram.marketAccessDesc: We’ll help you connect with major corporate clients (B2B) and build marketing for B2C
AccelerationProgram.prSupportTitleAcceleration: PR support from IT Park Uzbekistan
AccelerationProgram.prSupportDescAcceleration: You’ll receive media coverage, announcements, and support throughout all key stages of the program.
AccelerationProgram.preSelection: 150 startups selected based on initial criteria
AccelerationProgram.finalTeams: 15 teams + 10 reserve teams are accepted into the accelerator
AccelerationProgram.workshopsss: Workshops on tools, strategy, and public speaking
AccelerationProgram.investorPitch: Pitching to investors and VC funds
AccelerationProgram.selectedStartupsKpiFunding: Selected startups can receive up to $50,000 based on their KPI performance during the program
AccelerationProgram.investmentConditionsUzbekistan: To receive investment, winners must register a legal entity in Uzbekistan and sign a SAFE agreement with IT Park Uzbekistan

IncubationProgram.text1: The DSA Incubation Program is designed for early-stage startups. 25-30 selected teams will join a 3-month program with expert workshops, mentoring, and hands-on product support.
IncubationProgram.text3: Startups at the idea stage, MVP, or working prototype
IncubationProgram.text4: Willingness to participate in the program
IncubationProgram.text6: Startup registered in one of the 9 countries
IncubationProgram.selection150: 150 startups selected based on initial criteria
IncubationProgram.selection25: Selection of 25 teams for the incubation program
IncubationProgram.investorPresentation: Pitch to investors and VC funds
IncubationProgram.kpiBasedFunding: 15 startups will receive $10,000 in funding at the end of the program upon meeting their KPIs
IncubationProgram.investmentRequirements: To receive investment, winners must register a legal entity in Uzbekistan and sign a SAFE agreement with IT Park Uzbekistan

DigitalStartupProgram.DPSDescription: The Digital Startups program has been launched with a budget of 50 million dollars for promising tech startups. Funding, mentorship support, intellectual property protection, and access to the global market — all are combined in one powerful platform.
DigitalStartupProgram.DigitalStartupsOverview: A $50 million Digital Startups Program has been launched for promising tech startups. Funding, mentorship, intellectual property protection, and global market access — all on one powerful platform.
DigitalStartupProgram.AcceleratorGraduates: Number of startups that graduated from the accelerator
DigitalStartupProgram.ProgramSlogan: Create a big project, scale quickly
DigitalStartupProgram.ProgramIntroduction:
Startups, your time has come. Based on the decree of the President of Uzbekistan, a $50 million initiative - the 'Digital Startups' program - is entering the global technological arena.

Created to support a new generation of digital innovators, this program includes everything you need for rapid growth and entry into the global market: co-investments of up to $100,000, reimbursement of study costs at the best international accelerators, global mentoring support, full protection of intellectual property, and unsecured loans for startups.

With a national roadmap until 2026 and a regulatory sandbox to implement your ideas, this is not just support - it is the creation of large-scale projects from Uzbekistan to the whole world 'is your starting point for
DigitalStartupProgram.HowToApplyTitle: How to apply for the Digital Startups Program?
DigitalStartupProgram.HowToApplyDescription: Download and review the regulation on the procedure for submitting and evaluating applications to participate in the Digital Startups Program.
DigitalStartupProgram.CompanyAgeDescription: To participate in the program, a startup or company must have been operating for at least 6 months and no longer than 7 years.
DigitalStartupProgram.AnnualRevenueDescription: To be eligible, the company’s total revenue for one calendar year must not exceed 10 billion UZS.
DigitalStartupProgram.DocumentsDescription: To apply, the company must have previously completed at least one incubation or acceleration program successfully.
DigitalStartupProgram.BusinessModelDescription: Must have a business model based on digital technologies, with high growth potential and prospects for entering international markets.
DigitalStartupProgram.operationDurationDescription: To participate in the program, the startup or company must have been operating for at least 6 months and not more than 7 years.
DigitalStartupProgram.requiredDocumentsDescription: To apply for the program, the company must have previously participated in and successfully completed at least one incubation or acceleration program.
DigitalStartupProgram.annualRevenueDescription: To participate in the program, the company’s total annual revenue must not exceed 10 billion UZS.
DigitalStartupProgram.businessModelDescription: The company must have a business model based on digital technologies, with high growth potential and the ability to expand into foreign markets.
DigitalStartupProgram.compensationMechanism: The compensation mechanism is designed to support startups participating in leading international acceleration programs and training courses in entrepreneurship, business, and corporate management.
DigitalStartupProgram.foreignInvestmentSupport: A mechanism for providing investment funds to support startups that have attracted funding from foreign venture capital funds with assets of more than 50 million USD.
DigitalStartupProgram.ipSupportForStartups: Reimbursement of state fees and patent attorney services for registering intellectual property and trademarks for startups in Uzbekistan
DigitalStartupProgram.loanForStartups: Uzbek startups can receive unsecured loans of up to 300 million soums at the Central Bank rate + 4%.
DigitalStartupProgram.expertCostCoverage: Reimbursement of costs for engaging mentors for incubators and accelerators
DigitalStartupProgram.internationalAccelerationSupport: Reimbursement of expenses for Uzbek startups participating in international acceleration programs and training courses in business and management...
DigitalStartupProgram.foreignFundInvestment: When investments are attracted from foreign venture capital funds with assets exceeding 50 million dollars, Uzbek startups receive up to 100 thousand dollars...
DigitalStartupProgram.itVisaCondition: When investments are attracted from foreign venture capital funds with assets over 50 million dollars, Uzbek startups receive up to 100 thousand dollars...
DigitalStartupProgram.IncubAndAccDescription: The compensation mechanism is designed to support startups participating in leading international acceleration programs and educational courses in entrepreneurship, business, and corporate management.
DigitalStartupProgram.incubAndAccNote: If any errors are found, the application will be returned for revision with a notification via email. Corrections should be made in your personal account on startupbase.uz, after which the application can be resubmitted.
DigitalStartupProgram.applicationEligibilityItem2: Startups that have applied to the digital startup program and successfully passed the selection on the startupbase.uz platform.
DigitalStartupProgram.coveredExpensesItem1: Up to 50% of expenses related to participation in international acceleration programs or courses (not exceeding 20,000 USD).
DigitalStartupProgram.coveredExpensesItem2: Airfare (economy class) and accommodation costs within specified limits.
DigitalStartupProgram.reviewProcedureItem1: The application is reviewed by the Expert Commission within 15 working days.
DigitalStartupProgram.reviewProcedureItem2: The completeness of documents and compliance with requirements are verified.
DigitalStartupProgram.reviewProcedureItem3: If approved, the funds will be transferred to the applicant’s bank account within 10 banking days after the contract is signed.
DigitalStartupProgram.plusProgramDesc: There is a mechanism for providing investment funds aimed at supporting startups that have attracted funding from foreign venture funds with assets exceeding 50 million USD.
DigitalStartupProgram.plusProgramNote: If any errors are found, the application will be returned for revision with a notification sent via email. Corrections should be made in the personal account on the startupbase.uz website, after which the application can be resubmitted.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureEligibilityItem21: Startups that have applied for the digital startup program and successfully passed the selection process on the startupbase.uz platform.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureEligibilityItem31: Startups that have attracted funding from foreign venture funds with assets exceeding 50 million USD.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureCoveredExpensesItem1: Investment funds proportional to the attracted investments, but not exceeding 100,000 USD.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureReviewProcedureItem1: The application will be reviewed by the Venture Fund within 15 working days.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureReviewProcedureItem2: Completeness of documents and compliance with requirements will be checked.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureReviewProcedureItem3: The decision will be made by the Investment Committee.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureReviewProcedureItem4: If approved, the applicant signs the investment agreement and the funds will be transferred to the bank account within 5 banking days.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureRejectionReasonsItem2: Non-compliance with the requirements of the regulation.
DigitalStartupProgram.patentPageDescription: Reimbursement of state duties and patent attorney service fees for registering intellectual property and trademarks for startups in Uzbekistan
DigitalStartupProgram.patentEligibilityItem2: Startups that applied through the startupbase.uz platform for the digital startup program and successfully passed the selection.
DigitalStartupProgram.patentCoveredExpensesItem1: State duties for registering rights to intellectual property objects.
DigitalStartupProgram.patentReviewProcedureItem1: Applications are reviewed by the Expert Commission within 15 business days.
DigitalStartupProgram.patentReviewProcedureItem2: If approved, the applicant will be notified via the platform or by email.
DigitalStartupProgram.patentReviewProcedureItem3: Funds are transferred to the applicant’s bank account within 10 banking days after signing the reimbursement agreement.
DigitalStartupProgram.patentNote: If errors are found, the application will be returned for correction with a notification sent via email. Corrections must be made in the personal account on the startupbase.uz platform, after which the application can be resubmitted.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureLoanDescription: Startups in Uzbekistan can receive unsecured loans up to 300 million UZS at the Central Bank base rate + 4%.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureEligibilityItem2: Startups registered and selected on the startupbase.uz platform.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureEligibilityItem3: Startups with a transparent credit history and a clear business plan.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureExpensesItem1: Loan funds up to 300 million UZS at an interest rate (Central Bank base rate + 4%).
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureExpensesItem2: Loan terms vary from 6 months to 3 years.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureDocsItem1: Accounting documents: balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureDocsItem3: Detailed business plan (objectives, market analysis, profitability forecast, risks).
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureDocsItem4: Certificate of state registration of the legal entity.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureDocsItem6: Decision from the startup’s founders on their intention to receive loan funds.
DigitalStartupProgram.venturePurposeTitle: Purposes of using the loan funds:
DigitalStartupProgram.venturePurposeItem4: Other purposes (as stated in the application).
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureReviewItem1:
Submission stage:
The application is submitted via your personal account on startupbase.uz.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureReviewItem2:
Verification stage:
Completeness and compliance of documents are checked by the venture fund’s expert group within 30 business days.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureReviewItem3:
Decision-making stage:
The Investment Committee reviews the application and makes a decision.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureReviewItem4:
Contract signing stage:
If approved, the contract is signed, and the funds are transferred to the applicant’s bank account within 5 banking days.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureRejectionItem4: Violation of the rules for targeted use of the loan funds.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureFixItem1: If errors are found in the application, the applicant will be notified via email.
DigitalStartupProgram.ventureFixItem2: Corrections must be made through the personal account on the platform, after which the application must be resubmitted.
DigitalStartupProgram.mentorCostCoverageDescription: This program is designed to compensate up to 50% of expenses for legal entities in Uzbekistan that organize incubation and acceleration programs, specifically for engaging mentors and trainers.
DigitalStartupProgram.legalEntityRegistered: Legal entities registered in the territory of Uzbekistan.
DigitalStartupProgram.startupbaseMembers: Participants of the startup ecosystem registered on the startupbase.uz platform.
DigitalStartupProgram.activeOneYear: Legal entities with at least one year of activity.
DigitalStartupProgram.successfulPrograms: Organizations that have successfully implemented at least two incubation or acceleration programs.
DigitalStartupProgram.demoDayHeld: A Demo Day held at the end of the program (startups must have presented in front of investors).
DigitalStartupProgram.mentorTrainerFee: Fees paid to mentors and trainers.
DigitalStartupProgram.documentedExpenses: Expenses confirmed by contracts, service acts, invoices, payment orders, and bank statements.
DigitalStartupProgram.annualLimit: Annual limit: equivalent to 50,000 USD (within a calendar year).
DigitalStartupProgram.applicationLimitPerYear: Applications can be submitted twice a year.
DigitalStartupProgram.finalReport: Final report (program results, list of participants and mentors, photo report).
DigitalStartupProgram.contractWithMentor: Contracts and/or agreements signed with mentors/trainers.
DigitalStartupProgram.serviceStatements: Service acceptance acts for the provided services.
DigitalStartupProgram.paymentOrders: Payment orders and bank statements (if applicable).
DigitalStartupProgram.receiptsAndInvoices: Receipts, invoices, and other financial documents.
DigitalStartupProgram.submitViaPlatform: The application is submitted via the startupbase.uz platform.
DigitalStartupProgram.autoCalculation: Program cost and compensation limit are calculated automatically.
DigitalStartupProgram.submitAfterCompletion: After the program is completed, all documents are submitted via the platform.
DigitalStartupProgram.directorateReview: The Directorate reviews the application (5 working days).
DigitalStartupProgram.expertCommissionReview: The Expert Commission reviews the application (10 working days).
DigitalStartupProgram.agreementWithDirectorate: If approved, an agreement is concluded with the Directorate.
DigitalStartupProgram.fundTransfer: Funds are transferred to the applicant’s bank account within 10 banking days.
DigitalStartupProgram.programName: Enter the name of the incubation or acceleration program
DigitalStartupProgram.startupCount: Specify the number of startups that participated in this program
DigitalStartupProgram.successfulProgramsCount: How many successful programs have you conducted so far?
DigitalStartupProgram.demoDayQuestion: Was a Demo Day organized at the final stage of the project?
DigitalStartupProgram.mentorsExperience: Briefly describe the number of mentors/trainers involved and their experience
DigitalStartupProgram.averageProgramsPerMentor: On average, how many programs has each mentor participated in?
DigitalStartupProgram.programFormat: In what format was the program conducted?
DigitalStartupProgram.mentorsContractsUpload: Upload contracts and acts signed with the involved mentors
DigitalStartupProgram.financialDocumentsUpload: Upload financial documents confirming payments and expenses for mentors/trainers

ModalHowToApply.title: Apply
ModalHowToApply.description: Participation in the program is available only to registered participants of the Digital Startup Program.
ModalHowToApply.instruction: To participate, first register for the Digital Startup Program, then submit your application.

ChatBot.chatLimitText: Chat limit reached. End one to start a new one.
ChatBot.sampleQuestion1: How to start a startup? Step-by-step instructions.
ChatBot.sampleQuestion2: Help me analyze and improve my business model.
ChatBot.sampleQuestion3: Analyze my presentation and help me improve it.

explore_global_map_title: Explore the Global Startup Ecosystem Map
explore_global_map_description: The Global Startup Ecosystem Map is a crowdsourced community resource with hundreds of thousands of registered startups, unicorns, exits, coworking spaces, accelerators, influencers and organizations.
